title: Why?​
content: SuperQuest is really easy to setup and has Rich API with alot of customization.

title: QuestType​
content: </> interface QuestType { GoalsReached:: RBXScriptSignal QuestFolder:: Configuration Goals:: {GoalType} Create:: ( Player: Player , Name: string ) → QuestType ReachedAllGoals:: () → boolean GetInfo:: () → QuestInfo Destroy:: () → nil }

title: Goals​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Quest.Goals: {Goal}

title: ReachedAllGoals​
content: </> Quest:ReachedAllGoals() → boolean Returns a boolean if the Quest has reached all the goals that it was given

title: GetInfo​
content: </> Quest:GetInfo() → QuestInfo Returns useful information about the Quest

title: GoalType​
content: </> interface GoalType { Create:: ( Name: string, Quest: QuestType, StartValue: any, EndValue: any ) → GoalType SetValue:: (Value: any) → nil Destroy:: () → nil }

title: Name​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Goal.Name: string

title: Value​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Goal.Value: any The Value is the current Value of the Goal.

title: StartValue​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Goal.StartValue: any The StartValue is what the Value will start as.

title: EndValue​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Goal.EndValue: any The EndValue is what the Goal signifies as the "Finish Line". When the Value has reached the EndValue, the Goal is Finished.

title: Instance​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Goal.Instance: Configuration

title: Quest​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Goal.Quest: QuestType
